intro: Kedrostis glauca, commonly known as the blue spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and has a hairy, spiny stem. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Kedrostis glauca is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking flower color.
